page.title: 01BODMIN COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL
page.content: Bodmin School is situated on two sites. The first two years are housed in the old grammar school and the third to sixth years occupy the old secondary school. The comprehensive school was begun in 1974. The present headmaster is Mr. John Evans. There are 1418 pupils and 83 teachers. There are also 3 secretaries 6 technicians, 4 caretakers,2 grounds men and 30 kitchen and dinner ladies. The building consists of :- 50 classrooms, 15 work or craft rooms, 11 labratories, 2 libraries containing in total, 10,000 books, 2 staff rooms 3 common rooms and 15 offices. There are 30 different subjects taught at the school. On average a pupil studies 9 subjects. The comprehensive draws pupils from 11 feeder schools. There will be an intake of 228 pupils in September 1985
